cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi E of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then accelerating northeast across the Gulf, expected to cross the Florida Panhandle Friday night, sweep across GA/SC Saturday, and emerge off the NC/VA coast Sunday into the W-Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect east of the Ochlockonee River to Yankeetown, FL (Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning from the MS/AL border eastward to the Ochlockonee River, FL and Grand Isle, LA to the Pearl River mouth (Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast from LA to FL, inland southeast states, then Atlantic coasts of GA, SC, NC, and southeastern VA
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Sunday as the center passes southeast of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Hampton Roads; water-level rise limited to minor tidal anomalies
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Sunday may total 2–3 in., causing brief ponding and reduced visibility
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave action Sunday–Monday could disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations
